review_list:
What a nice experience! The food is incredibly fresh and full of flavor. This is a restaurant that focuses on delivering great food without the pretence of external factors or embellishments destracting its customers.
Thank you.

Small hole-in-the wall take-out place next to a low-rise walkup apartment building that shares a parking lot with American Savings Bank. Two parking stalls out front and two picnic table benches. Various types of poke bowls (ahi, tako) of different sizes with a choice of white or brown rice. Our brown rice was a little wet but we liked the...


More  



Really delicious poke. Shoyu and Hawaiian style were actually more flavourful than spicy in my opinion.

Perfect break form resort food. The family shared the shoyu ahi and taco as well as the spicy ahi poke for a light lunch. Plus two drinks for $15. Can't miss.

Lovely food great service. Have had poke 4 times and this was the best. Price was awesome, half of what we paid on the strip.

This place never disappoints, even now when you got to queue to order. Just dont step out of line. Know what you want, study the menu first, have your money ready. See what others are eating outside. And if you don't know what to order, then just order the popular or the usual bowls most customers order or just ask...


More  



I have tried about 5 different places. This place for taste and value is the best. There are other places for poke, so let us know what you find.

A small take-out place with a few selections of boxed poke and rice combos. Fresh fish, good portion sizes, reasonable prices. Would be a good place for poke (i.e., sushi/sashimi) lovers. Located in a small plaza.

I saw a lot of locals eat here and another customer recommended the spicy ahi poke. It was so good! For $8, you get the poke and a drink. What a great deal, especially in Hawaii!

We had our navy friend fly a cooler full of poke to Florida! Yes!! When you have the best it is hard to go back. So never go back! Ono seafood is no ka oi in quality and the folks are super hospitable, Ohana. Lance & Kim are so great!
title: Ono Seafood, Honolulu
address: 747 Kapahulu Ave, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96816

review_list:
One of the highlights of our trip. Be sure to check days/time for when Helena's is open. Get there early, as the parking lot is very small. Servers will walk you through the menu - they even have a "picture book" with their items.

I went for lunch with another person and we had Kalua pig, the short ribs, poi, white rice and fried butter fish collar. Everything was fantastic. I have been going to Hawaii since I was a kid, going to luaus, food trucks etc. My lunch partner agreed. Fantastic! As of this writing, the restaurant is only open Tuesday through Friday.

Well parking is limited and you can expect a wait. The people are nice and it's authentic local food. But the location is not so great, it's the getto. If you're going to the Polynesian Cultural Center save the time and just do the luau there. The foods right in line with this. I would not return here.

Tried the kalua pork and the ribs. Both really good but not the best food we had on the island. Complimentary coconut haupia was actually delicious. Almost 5 stars.

The food is very good but there is no atmosphere to speak about as it is a hole in the wall. Go for the food.

want authentic, try Helena's, not for everybody ..............
laulau, pipikaula very good ....
limited parking ..........

It just does not get any better than this. Talk about a local Hawaii experience. Everything about Helena's SCREAMS authentic Hawaiian food. Everything. Come early, find a table, and ask the folks sitting at the next table what to order. They'll be happy to give some pointers, guaranteed. This is a family friendly sort of place. Come hungry.

Went here for lunch with a few friends one day. I ordered everything ala carte: squid luau, pipikaula short rib, and poi. OMG it was the best short rib ever! Everything was so delicious! Will definitely go back. FYI, they're a cash only establishment, parking is limited, and they are closed on Mondays.

This is a Great place for Hawaiian food. I always recommend it to my visiting friends but it has a few inconveniences: small place (limited seating, always order to go), Long lines to get food (Because is good!!!) and limited parking. My recommendation is to visit this place off heavy traffic hours or order via phone like i do.

Food is always of good quality. This is the place to go for great local Hawaiian food. Service is great.
title: Helena's Hawaiian Food, Honolulu
address: 1240 N School St, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96817

review_list:
This stop is a must! Delicious meal with a sunset view! Reviews from TA sent us here...wish we would have had tine to eat there again! And the price can't be beat! Mahalo!

This is a great place to grab a quick bite to eat. The salad is a great Spring Blend and the steak was excellent with the Hawaiian BBQ sauce on the counter.

Third visit, always tasty $ 17.50 with a drink for two, great value for money will be back again and again, give it a try will not disappoint.

Steak Shack is a great place to grab a quick bite! The staff is always friendly. The food is so delicious. I always get the chicken combo for $7.50; the combo comes with chicken, rice, and fresh green salad. The price is very reasonable for Waikiki. You can't beat the view of Fort DeRussy Beach Park.

Heard about this from tripadvisor posters. So search was on. This place was between the Ft. DeRussy army museum and Waikiki Shore hotel. It is on the beach. You can reach this from a public walkway between the two or we entered by going up a ramp that leads to the parking spaces for the Waikiki Shore hotel (corner of...


More  



Steak, rice and slalom for $9 U.S., great value and soooo fresh. don't miss this, especially good for Aussies as the dollar is falling.

We had to try this place after all of the reviews we read. We are staying at the Hyatt so we decided to walk down to the steak shack for lunch. It's about a half a mile walk on the beach. When we got there we ordered our food and it was ready in 5 minutes. We got the steak...


More  



$8 fot steak, rice, and s salad. We sat outside to enjoy our meals and the view of the ocean. Staff were friendly. Meal was cooked just as I like.

We had the steak/chicken combo plate, and shared it. Great food, will go again before we leave Honolulu. I would be happy with either steak or chicken, but the combo gives an extra taste! No tables, but who cares. There are a few places to sit nearby, or sit on the beach.

This is a takeaway kiosk situated on a public walkway between the Fort DeRussy museum and the Outrigger Reef on the Beach Hotel. There are snack stools and bar tables along one railing.
If you fancy an inexpensive tasty meal to eat whilst you watch the world go by at sunset on the beach, then this is the place
title: Steak Shack, Honolulu
address: 2161 Kalia Road, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96815

review_list:
Just treated my belly to a lamb lumpia and kimchi ramen. It's happy and I'm extremely happy. Illikoi margarita with a little mezcal rounded the entire dining experience.

Food here is excellent. Limited menu of exceptional items. On this trip I had two: the lobster shu man in beurre blanc sauce and a beet and spicy greens salad, both great. I have eaten a gazillion beet salads over the years but this one stood out. Two different colored beets were thinly sliced and then layered like a Napoleon....


More  



Lucky Belly has a late night menu that they serve street side, and it is almost always a pleasant surprise. Jalapeño Mac & Cheese, Kalua Pig Sliders, great noodle dishes - a great place to visit when you're working late.

I love a good bowl of soup. This place is very cool and is obviously the soup "see and be seen". I felt lucky to get a seat at the bar. The hype works! The soup was good but it didn't live up to the hype. Nor did I feel it was worth the price.

Cannot fault this place , service , food everything great, love the appetisers, the owner is a wonderful host, only downfall, typical of downtown is parking!!!!

Had the ramen twice. Broth and condiments are good but broth is not hot enough. Asked for it to be really hot the second time but still warm which is why it gets only 4 stars.

This is a small but very appealing restaurant, with excellent food and very accommodating staff. You are warmly welcomed, the service is prompt and the food could not be better for the price and quality offered. Ramen is their specialty, and of course the pig belly is not to be missed, but the menu is so well presented and varied...


More  



Met my friend for a quick lunch on a Wednesday. Place was crowded but we managed to snag a table way in back. The menu was varied and tempting. My friend ordered the usual Lucky Belly bowl. Always a sure thing. I had the Crab/lobster/shrimp cake on Somen noodles. We waited for a long time 15-20 min for our food....


More  



Warm reception and immediate seating, welcome ice water, menus, questions answered. My husband had the "famous" beast bowl full full of nutritious good noodle/vegetable ingredients; there were several kinds to choose from. He loved it. I had the lobster/shrimp dim sum; it was wonderful. Three of these were plenty. Delicious lemon butter sauce. I also ordered the very creative beet/goat...


More  



This place in Chinatown has delicious pupus & a pretty good dinner menu. Their selection of drinks is wide. Make reservations if going between 5:30-6
title: Lucky Belly, Honolulu
address: 50 North Hotel Street, Smith Street, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96817

review_list:
Get a reservation no matter what time you go. This is a restaurant everyone wants to visit: tourists and locals alike. And there is a reason!

Seriously amazing food and exceptional, knowledgeable service from great staff! Had to go a second time in our visit!!

I'll start by saying I'm very lucky, and have been able to eat at many amazing restaurants all over the world. That being said, the tasting menu at The Pig and the Lady is easily one of the best all around meals I've had. When compared to other similarly sized tasting menus, it is also an amazing value. From start...


More  



Atmosphere - rustic. Somewhat noisy. However, the food is well worth a visit. They also have a stall at the Farmers Market on Wednesday late afternoon in the concert hall grounds. I often stop by for a container of Pho to take home.

I visited the Pig and the Lady for the first time last week with a couple of friends. We all loved it. Our server was friendly; she recommended several dishes, and suggested that we share. We all loved our dishes so much that we barely gave each other a bite. I had the fish, Cha Ca Vong. It's a mild...


More  



This restaurant has good food with tasty pho soup and has alot of energy with the crowds that seem to be all the time.
Only hardship is finding parking as there is not designated parking lot for this place. At night, the area is close to Chinatown and it feels somewhat uneasy to walk to the restaurant alone.

I have been to this restaurant for both lunch and dinner. Different vibe during the day with the working crowd. At night is is hip and fun. My favorite is the pho dip bahn mi. Get it with the side of noodles so you can enjoy every delicious drop of the pho broth. I wish they would put this on...


More  



We have dined here several times, and each time was a great experience. The food is innovative, the service is excellent, and the bar offers some amazing exotic cocktails.
Hip, fun, and enjoyable food with a Vietnamese flair, you will enjoy your visit to this trendy downtown eatery.

This review is for people like me who have never tried Vietnamese food before.
Despite the rave reviews by the cognoscenti, we found the Pho, which consists of a soup consisting of noodles, a quarter sized piece of meat, bean sprouts, coriander and fennel, to be worth about 1/10 of the price. Likewise the vaunted fish dish, with a very...


More  



I had a family of eight people who wanted to dine here so you can imagine my stress when I walked by and told that tables were booked for the night but that there is walk-in seating for the bar. We all waited at the door by 5:15pm for 5:30pm opening and snatched half the bar seating when the door...


More
title: The Pig and the Lady, Honolulu
address: 83 N King St, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96817

review_list:
The best cuisine in Hawaii ! Been going there for 15 years. Fresh and excellent local ingredients, striving all the time to be better: Go there , classy in a subdued kind of way. We ordered all appetizers last time. They are so good , why continue on to the main menu? But if you do, you are in for...


More  



Wonderful dinner. Great service. Amazingly creative menu. The pan steamed opakapaka was the best fish (and fish is always my first choice) I've ever eaten. I've been before and hopefully I'll go again. Never disappointing.

We had a wonderful experience here: unique menu, delicious food and excellent service. We went for a special occasion and they were happy to accommodate. We'll go back!

Although a bit pricey, dinner was lovely. Very impressed with the service and quality of food. The wine list was extensive with really good wines by the glass.

Without question, the Tasting Menu drop dead excellent. The wine paring was perfect. The service was first class, and the evening was memorable.

My wife and I were very much looking forward to this restaurant and it didn't disappoint. The food was excellent and the staff were very pleasant, though they could have done more to engage us and make relevant suggestions. Given how busy the packed restaurant was, the staff did a very good job. Highly recommend the tasting menu with matching...


More  



I took my wife here for her birthday last month, The staff is friendly and happy but two things; First- our waiter was far to touchy, I don't mind a hand on my shoulder every now and then but not every time you come to the table. It was so bad that the party I was with started making a...


More  



We both tried the tasting menu and every course was delicious! The service was amazing and the setting is very interesting and delightful. Highly recommended.

We have visited Alan Wong's 3 times in the last year, with and without friends. They always hit the mark, with impeccable customer service and delicious food. Getting up to the restaurant is always interesting in a small elevator with unmarked buttons, but once there, you are seated quickly (with a reservation). The staff is a bit overblown, but that's...


More  



We would have rate this restaurant excellent, but the service was both arrogant and snooty. All dishes were well prepared and great tasting. Perhaps it was only our waiters that needed better training, Since the food was so god, we would return.
title: Alan Wong's Restaurant, Honolulu
address:
1857 S King St, Fl 3RD, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96826-2100

review_list:
Great food and HUGE portions. We had fried squid with a soupy dressing, poki, clams with a veggie dressing and a taco plate. All delicately seasoned. While there really isn't any ambiance - nothing to worry about, the efficient service and quality of the offering make more than up for it

It's a small place, so understand if you have to wait for a table. We arrived at 5:30 and seated right away. It was very fun to eat through the Pupus menu. Calamari, kalua pork fried rice, dynamite shrimp, and pork sliders on taro rolls. The biggest surprise winner was the Hapa Potato rolls. They are fried spring roll filled...


More  



With a name and description of Uncle Bo's Pupu Bar & Grill we were expecting a more low-key atmosphere. Walked in and were pleasantly surprised by the modern appearance. Sat at the bar and enjoyed some very well prepared dishes.

We stumbled across this wonderful restaurant. There is something on the menu to please everyone. The portions are MASSIVE but they will happily give you a dish to share and/or a doggy bag. Make sure to save some room for dessert!

My husband and I stopped in Haleiwa on our way back from the Volcom. What a surprise! We often make poor choices but not this time - and really not our choice. The gals at Uncle Bo's made selections that blew us away - everything was amazing and so delicious! To top it off they brought us a dessert that...


More  



Great Food (order the cheese on bread with beef and mushrooms; deep fried doughnut dessert balls). Loud music creates a good vibe. Awesome cocktails (cucumber gin mix or gummiebear slow shot). Hidden gem for a school night party!

Very good food but the place is quite noisy as well as being so cold I was freezing by the time we left.

This was a surprise. Saw an ad in a local news sheet and decided to try it. Bit of a bus trip. Very good assortment of food.Try the firecracker shrimp. Tables close enough to strike up conversation with the people next to you if you're the intrusive high sociability type.

My husband and I just finished eating. What a great meal! We had the crab cakes, and the S.O.S. I can not express how good it was in this small space. Server was top notch as well. Park across street in the city lot. Must try! Great service, large portions. Try the beinets for dessert.

Wife and I just finished eating. What a great meal! We had the crab cakes, and the S.O.S. I can not express how good it was in this small space. Server was top notch as well. Park across street in the city lot. Must try!
title: Uncle Bo's Pupu Bar & Grill, Honolulu
address: 559 Kapahulu Ave, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96815-3855

review_list:
Dine at sunset for a perfect experience! Cant say enough about the menu options (some of us had small plates - some never stopped eating!). Delicious food with a view that can't be beat. Make reservation in advance for outside table!

Being a veteran of many a London tea I thought I'd give this Hawaii version a try. The view at the outside corner of Orchids could not be better anywhere in the world. They start with the best scones and poppy seed buns I've ever had - lemon curd first rate. The sandwiches were standard tea fare and the desserts...


More  



On the final night of our 7 night Hawaiian vacation, we wanted to go somewhere special. Orchids had received good reviews in our travel guide and was recently awarded the 4 or 5 Diamond Award. We were celebrating my wife's birthday. The ocean side table was nice and the staff very attentive. The sea bass that I ordered was way...


More  



We wee so excited to try this restaurant. It is located in the beautiful Halekulani Hotel, which is highly upscale. We knew what to expect price-wise, but thought we would be gazing over the ocean, not at a grassy back yard family picnic. During our meal, the table next to us, with 3 couples and a small child, talked loudly,...


More  



We stayed at the Halekulani Hotel and ate several times at Orchids. They have exceptional fish including onaga and roasted lobster to die for. Service is exceptional and the wine list is extensive

Dined with friends at Orchids. Service was top notch with friendly and courteous wait staff. Both the seafood and steaks were excellent. Wine list is a bit pricey but we managed to find a pinot noir we like at a reasonable price. The view of the sunset is fabulous.

We were staying at the Halekulani so decided to try Orchids -- one of their two fine dining restaurants.Professional and prompt service. Veal chop was first class as was my wife's petit filet.

Orchids is one of our favorite restaurants this along with Michel's is the best restaurant in Oahu. The quality of food, menu, the view, the ambiance, and the service sets these restaurants apart from others. We come here every winter, at least twice, once for the dinner and love the Sunday Brunch!

Orchids is a lovely restaurant. The atmosphere is amazing with the open air dining area. The location is beautiful and inviting and the hotel it is located in is lovely to visit as well.
We had dinner with friends and had a great meal. The service was a bit slow at first but it got better as the meal went...


More  



Great ambiance, food and service. This restaurant is clearly a 10! Food is imaginative, tasty and well prepared.
title: Orchids, Honolulu
address:
Halekulani Hotel, 2199 Kalia Rd., Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96815 

 (Lewers Street)

review_list:
As other reviewers have suggested, the restaurant's location is perfect for sunsets and an enjoyable meal.
The daily fish special was Swordfish. Perfectly cooked. The Short Rib was very tasty. The only issue was that the plates were cold. Dinner plates should be hot. So, the beef rib was lukewarm.
Desserts were very good, too.
A general complaint was that...


More  



The 5* is for ambiance. The food is OK but the service and location are outstanding. Request a table outside, watch the Hawaiian band and hula dancer and enjoy a beautiful sunset. Expect to pay up for drinks but they are delicious.

We waited for about an hour to have a nice dinner watching the sunset and listening to Hawaiian music...and turned out to be a disappointment. We ordered the fish of the day and it was so chewy and fishy we had to send it back. They gave us a new dish which turned out to be exactly the same. We...


More  



Having loved the charming, atmospheric Halekulani Hotel many years ago, we took a nostalgic trip to the shocking place it has become. Wow. Where grass and sand once surrounded an iconic entertainment venue, there is now a concrete patio and sea wall. It is overrun with tourists, very crowded, and monster concrete hotel towers surround the area. The food was...


More  



I will address dessert in a bit but first.... This is a delicious top notch restaurant in a very comfortable, casual atmosphere. The staff has the quintessential family feeling, from the initial seating to service. Food is delicious, we went for lunch so it was a choice of sandwiches, salads or fish. I ordered the Ruben with was panini style...


More  



We stayed at the Halekulani Hotel and ate breakfast and;lunch daily for 8 days. They have an extensive breakfast buffet appealing to many cultures as well as an omelette bar. The waitstaff was very helpful and were always very responsive. At lunch the soup changes daily and there is a featured fish dish.

Thoroughly enjoyed a sunset cocktail and dinner at House Without a Key. The cocktails were beautiful and not watered down like elsewhere. Staff were attentive and very welcoming while not over the top. The food was delicious. While not the high end dining at the Halekulani, House Without a key was absolutely ideal for cocktails and a more relaxed while...

The setting is spectacular and the evening entertainment was delightful. MaiTais the best we have had on Waikiki. The food, however, is very average. Barbecue ribs were okay with very little meat. Definitely a great place for drinks and appetizers but I'd choose somewhere else for dinner.

Our party of 5 went here for drinks after watch g the sunset on Waikiki beach.
The mood and ambiance is very relaxing and classy.
We only had drinks, but we're treated to beautiful Hawaiian music from a trio of father son and daughter.
Then the highlight of the evening!
MISS HAWAII did several hulas accompanied by the music.

we didn't eat here this trip but sat back and relaxed with a refreshing cocktail after a very busy day of sightseeing...a lovely quiet atmosphere,open to the beach.
title: House Without a Key, Honolulu

review_list:
Had heard amazing things about this steakhouse and it all looked the part from the sold out bookings to the strict dress code and fancy wait staff. That's where it ended - staff were very slow to serve us and the food was something I would be ashamed to put out on my own private dining table. We had the...

This is one of the best Steak Restaurants we have been too. With "Melt in your Mouth" Steaks, try the Fillet Mignon it is fantastic. My lovely lady took me there for my birthday 9th Feb, and we both thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Don & Louise- Sydney Australia.

Not cheap but so worth it. They let you share and come and cut up at the table. Fantastic wait staff. Dont bother ordering fish. The rib eye on the bone is so great and heaps enough for two. Great decor.

Wonderful atmosphere, good music, excellent wait staff and unbelievable food! You'll never want to leave.

It was lovely to have great service and white table cloths! Locals dine here so we thought it would be good. Well it was, we had appetisers of crab cakes and the wild mushroom with asparagus. Then we ordered the local speciality kiawe broiled steak. High,y recommended with the garlic mash, melt in your mouth steak, fabulous atmosphere and you...

I've been going to Hy's for years and just the other night, attended a private company function there. Hy's was incredibly busy in the public dining rooms, and we had no less than 6 waiters attending to our party of 24. I noted that the majority of diners were local - always a good sign. Hy's has always been known...


More  



High end establishment with expert waiting staff and terrific, classic food. Gorgeous decor. Men need to wear a collar and covered shoes. Delicious meal and amazing flambé dessert. Wonderful experience.

Went to Hy's last night and had a very enjoyable meal. Right from the Appetizers "Escargot" followed by a table side Ceasar made salad, an excellent wine recommendation followed by a nice bone in Strip Loin cooked perfectly with mashed potatoes and Asparagus! No room for desert or the mashed potatoes but would recommend to you to enjoy this restaurant...

We discovered Hy's nearly 10 years ago and go back every time we are in Waikiki because we find the service and food to be impeccable. While this is a steakhouse, with phenomenal steaks, their seafood options are also fresh and delicious.

This is a first class fine dining restaurant. We went for Happy Hour yesterday and ordered a Kale Strawberry salad, a Prime Rib French Dip sandwich and Beef Sliders. I was very sorry that I didn't find this place earlier - after 10 days of eating good food (Expensive) in Hawaii I found greatness here. Very small restaurant and I was lucky there was not wait time....

Parked right outside where there is a parking meter. I passed the place twice trying to find it.
Waiter helped me order because I had no clue what anything was that I was reading, except rice. There aren't descriptions of the dishes nor pictures. It was pretty good but I really don't have anything to judge by, since it was...

Don't let the size fool you. You wait outside and someone will come out and let you know wait time. 10-15 mins for us. There is no alcohol here but we saw someone else bring some in.
We order the combo plate which was enough for us three ladies who weren't starving.
Make sure you have cash to pay with.

This is another one of our must-go-to spots on Oahu whenever in town. We always make time for Ono Hawaiian Foods on the main drag of Kapahulu. A very unassuming establishment, this is where to get the most authentic Hawaiian cuisine not far from Waikiki. This is where we get our lau-lau fix and it comes complete with a party...

Real good Hawaiin food that is authentic. Bring your own beer or wine if you wish. Three of us shared the combo which was perfect.

Great find and a little shop with a big reputation with locals. Had the lau lau, polo and Kalua pork. It was all very tasty and tasted as home cooked. Very friendly service that HAWAII is famed for. Definitely worth a stop if you want to try local food. Very easy to find and close to Waikiki.

At ONO Hawaiin food you don't only get great food but also a little bit of information on what you are eating. It's a little off the beaten track but definitly worth the walk from the overly crowded and overly touristy Waikiki beach. Second time visiting this restaurant in two weeks. Both times we had very good food. Last time we went on the owner's recommendations and weren't disappointed. Both times we got there an hour before it closed, and they were starting to run out of their "popular" items.

Love the food there. We had a combination plate which offers a little bit of everything Hawaiian. I loved the Laulau. My husband was very impressed by their chicken long rice soup. The owner is very friendly and offered us some samples. Parking is a bit hard.

If you want an authentic taste of true Hawaiian food. . . This is the place you should go. It small and not your typical luxury restaurant like in Waikiki but each time I come here, it's one of my first spots to eat at.
title: ONO Hawaiian Foods, Honolulu

Please, though, for the love of dining, just go back to using round plates. I cannot stand this trend of using square and...

I ate at the bar because the restaurant was full and only offered formal dining. There was a band that was good but very loud. Staff was friendly, but the food was average at most.

We ate two seafood dinners and one breakfast. Outstanding flavors and wait service. Mai-Tai's with fresh squeezed juices.

Great view and unbelievable sunsets.
We could not fault the food and service was excellent.
Make sure you get a seat on the balcony for uninterrupted view of the sunset.

After my wife and I arriving in Hawaii and having a bit of jet lag, our concierge recommended a nearby casual restaurant. We had a great meal, but the service was a little lax. We had to ask for a drink menu after waiting for 10-15 minutes after being seated. The adult entrees came 5 minutes before the kids meals.

We went to Hula Grill for dinner on our last night in Waikiki. It's right upstairs from the famous Dukes. Our table had a beautiful view of the oceanfront. And the food and drinks were top notch. quality of food was very good, service was also very good considering we were a party of 11 people, atmosphere in restaurant was nice and relaxed, recommend over its neighboring restaurant "Dukes"

Nice view with very average food. Our server Trinette, was really lousy. Went here for dinner with my family, the food and service was the best on the island. Food is fresh, service is great. Our server was really helpful on suggestions. One of the best places to eat in Hawaii.
title: Hula Grill Waikiki, Honolulu

2335 Kalakaua Ave, Ste 203 over top of Duke's, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96815

review_list:
We had the crab cakes and scallops. They were amazing and on point. Wait staff is supper attentive and never had an empty glass and a cocktail was always on my table. Amazing service and a must while visiting.

If you drink nowhere else, stop in for a pineapple martini .. but don;t eat the fruit unless you have a designated driver! Delicious, but dangerous! Ahi was delicious, too!

We have been to various Roy's restaurants, most often the Original Roy's, but this was our first visit to the Waikiki location. Both my wife and I enjoyed our dinners. We were pleased that the restaurant is not as noisy as some of the others. The service was truly outstanding.

My husband and I went for dinner and were blown away. The appetizers, meal and desserts were amazing. We went with the set courses and wine pairings. Was well worth it. Would definitely recommend.

Enjoyable to sit on the terrace on a warm evening. All of us thought the food was top quality, especially the steaks. Not cheap, but good service and great food more than compensated.Wouldnt hesitate to eat there again.

What a great little place! A great mix of Japanese Musubi and Hawaiian flare - Spam! The staff is extremely friendly and helpful on recommendations. Cannot recommend this place enough. Everything on the menu is amazing. Do yourself a favor and stop by.

Went to Musubi cafe for breakfast a few times while in Waikiki. The best Musubi I've ever had. The egg is cooked to perfection. Just get the Spam+Egg+Bacon+Avacado or Cucumber, can't go wrong. I do not recommend the rice balls, has too much rice.

After getting to know Honolulu, you begin to know where the best places are.
This is one of those places.

Spam is not my choice of food, but it is a Hawaiian favourite, and Japanese tourists seemed to enjoy their dishes. Also popular were fish and noodle dishes.

This place has a good variety of Musubi, good prices, and is close to Waikiki beach. Great place. I already miss going there now that I've left.

This place is a Japanese travelers' dream. You can get your lunch or snack rice balls in so many flavors, fresh made to order! Their Spam Musubis are very creative and delicious. I got so addicted that I bought some for my flight back to home.

We walked over to Dukes from the Hawaiian village. The walk od the beach was so enjoyable. Hit Dukes and had a couple drinks and then tried out the buffet. What a great selection of Quality items. This buffet was by the best I had seen in years. Definitely go back here for sure.

This was our second visit to Dukes in 18 months. Dinner is always busy so reservations are a must. Excellent food, service and atmosphere directly on the beach. If you are not within walking distance from your hotel, take a taxi.

Just had a couple drinks here, but fun. Recommended. Obviously a very popular place. Good people watching also.

Very busy place with a good selection of appetizers and drinks. Right on the beach in Waikiki. Be prepared for a wait if you want an outside table.

Great place to people watch, the food was ok but the Hula Pie is wonderful if you like ice-cream, amazing views as well

Spectacular view at sunset, whether your at the canoe club, the barefoot bar or on the Lanai, the is a large selection of awesome food, the over atmosphere is very welcoming and relaxing.

If you want to experience a walk-up from Waikiki beach to decent food and cocktails eatery...Duke's is #1. The food is good, the drinks are good, and Waikiki beach couldn't be closer. There is tons of outdoor seating and even a shower to remove sand from the beach.

Good food and cold beer with a view! Dukes has two bars so I found getting a drink to be easy.This place is right on the beach and around dinner time becomes the place to be. The prices are what I would call average for the location. Be sure to get a table by the railing for the best view.

On the beach at Waikiki, good food, great service and fun atmosphere. Menu has plenty of variety including the range of cocktails.

we all enjoyed our meals recommend ordering the eggs Benedict with sauce on the side so as you can add it as you like it, if you order this with the salmon it isn't raw but cooked which I didn't like. Coffees were ok & prices are reasonable , service was very friendly and quick

We visited this restaurant twice during our 2 week stay. The service and food was excellent. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

food rated really goo. they have great servers however the portions are too small. but worth a visit too see though

Happy Hour is one of the best in Waikiki. The MaiTai's are really strong. The live music is nice without being to intrusive. The service is great. The food is touch and go. The person we had was slow and had trouble speaking English.
The food was good but not great.
My wife like her lava flow drink.
Overall it was OK, just not great.

Moana Terrace is located at the pool bar in the Marriott. I stay at the hotel about 4 times a year and make it a point to stop in on every stay. More  



Pricey as you would expect in a hotel. I had a Caesar shrimp salad and my husband had a club. Wonderful place to see sunset as well.

The MT has an excellent location on the third floor overlooking the beach. They have a limited happy hour (4-6) and we enjoyed drinks and nibbles after walking the nearby park. It is part of a Marriott property so the standards are good. Good spot to relax.

Maybe we were just lucky but we had the nicest waitresses and everything we tried was delicious. We'd go there again. It's a great chill-out spot with live music Saturday nights.

Located poolside at the Marriott we had a drink here most nights during our stay here and found it a relaxed atmosphere with good food and drinks

Looking down onto Waikiki from a couple floors up is the way to dine. Fun atmosphere, there was music when we were there. Tasty drinks and a Marriott burger. Good times.

we had a great waitress and she looked after us well. Food was lovely. Nice atmosphere with the central fireplace going at night.

My husband and I stopped here for cocktails, however the thing that impressed us the most was the live bands they had playing, they were absolutely great!

Thoroughly enjoyed the food, which was tasty, varied and came in very large serves. The main I chose with 4 vegetables of choice was more than I could eat (and I have a solid appetite). Definitely a takeaway worth visiting

There are a lot of food choices in the Ala Moana shopping center, but I think this is the best of the fast food places. Good meat and sides. A good deal.

I always come to this place whenever I'm in Waikiki area in Honolulu, Hawaii. Yummy is at the food court of Ala Moana mall. Price is reasonable for the tasty chicken BBQ with choices of 4 sides. Dine-in or take-out.

Great fast food. Love the variety and all the veggies lots of options for different foods. Very large portions. Two people could share one plate and be full. Food is fresh and made to order. Highly recommend this place.

Stopped by the food court for lunch and had the meat jun plate with mac salad, spinach, bean sprouts, and kimchee (you get a choice of 4 side dishes with your entree). It was good and satisfied my craving for Korean food. They give you enough food for two meals, but the price is too high for a plate lunch....

I ate here twice during our latest visit. I always find the food to be fresh and tasty. I had the mini kal-bi and really enjoyed it. Good portions at a reasonable price. Will definitely return

Fantastic ramen house! Really enjoyed my first bowl of ramen at this noodle house. The gyozas were amazing and fresh. Service was efficient friendly and fast. If your out shopping in Ward this is the place to go! I'd def go again !

If you're shopping at the mall and the food court leaves you dizzy and uninterested , this is the best of a half dozen "noodle" restaurants scattered around the acres of shopping. It is fast, friendly and has two really excellent beers on draft (Kirin and Hawaiian Longboard)

Every time I visit Oahu I always stop here to have a bowl of delicious vegetable tan tan ramen. The broth has the perfect amount of spiciness to it and the vegetables are plentiful and yummy. Always get a side of gyoza. A trip to Oahu is not complete without a big bowl of tan tan ramen!

On the ground level Oceanside in the Ala Moana shopping centre. This restaurant is always busy and rarely is without a line up. It is possible to have a bowl of delicious ramen for under $10.00. I would suggest going off peak hours unless you don't mind waiting

This is a great place to go for ramen that satisfies your craving. My husband had the seafood tantan ramen(made with miso) and I had the char sui shoyu ramen. We also shared a gyoza plate. Each time we come to Hawaii, we always eat here at least once. It is so tasty, and value for money, and filling. How could you not eat here. Service is great, and staff helpful in explaining menu if you need help.

I haven't eaten here for awhile, but my taste buds can recall the delicious broth. I was disappointed because the broth did not taste the same. Did they change the ingredients or perhaps the
cook?

Good food - able to get a nice selection of vegetarian items.
Fresh and hot food, quick service, reasonable price.

The food here is very reasonably priced and tasty. Try the Hong Kong chicken wings, absolutely delicious!!

We ate here a couple of times while in Honolulu and the food was very good. Certainly good enough to bring us back again. Not only was the food great, but the price was reasonable and the quantity very good.

Great fresh Chinese food. Reasonable prices. Select from sides and a main dish. Excellent for a quick and run, or sit down and relax.

Cheap, plentiful and delicious. We liked it so much we ate here 2 days in a row. Not usually a food court fan but this might have just changed my mind.

The food was fine but just what you would expect from all others just more expensive . We did get the cashew shrimp for an extra $1.50

Had honey walnut shrimp after trying a sample. Was surprised that they gave me a sample of the shrimp, but did when I mentioned I have never had it.
The sauce was excellent and the shrimp very tasty. Noodles were okay.

Fast Chinese food, with great flavors that is affordable.
Orange Chicken is a favorite with many other dishes to taste.
free samples are provided upon request.
2 meals with drinks approx USD $24.00
Worth a try.

I purchased a side and 2 entree choices and I usually do not choose Asian food at a food court but I was pleasantly surprised. I selected the fried rice, orange chicken and beef and broccoli choice. Big meal, decent price and totally yummy. Highly recommend if you have the chance

After being pursuaded with a sample to taste we bought a meal and soda each. Very tasty and good quality for "fast food ". Lucky it was served in styrene containers, as neither of us could eat it all. After a good walk, we were able to enjoy the rest. Would buy again

Have eaten here many time through the years. I enjoy there Sicilian Pizza and pasta dishes. Quality is hit or miss depending on how bust they are. Looks like the give another type of bread now days with your meals. It actually has some flavor now. CPK is okay but only when near Kahala and in the mood.

Because they don't begin to assemble your order until you finally make your way up front. The message is clear: you don't count.

A WIDE range of foods to choose from, with amazing tastes!! Definitely one to try, incredible pasta, pizza, salads and lettuce cups. Great for everyone as there is so much to choose from. Great atmosphere as it is really busy! Loved it.

I have been here twice in December 2015. Once with a large party of 15 people and one with my wife. On both occasions, the service was very good and the food was very good. Fast paced restaurant but still very relaxed atmosphere.

CPK Kahala has an extensive menu of Pasta, Pizza and Specialty items. The location is convenient to shopper and movie goers. It is one of the busiest California Pizza Kitchens in Honolulu. It is one of the restaurants that I always return to.

Pick up sandwich to take to beach or to airport here. Daily specials, fresh, and convenient. Not usually too crowded.

Hats off to the people that work here. Super friendly. They got the line quickly taken care of. They're open late, too!

If you want sandwich, this is the place go. I order tuna sandwich and it was good. The price is reasonable.

Gilligan's Beach Shack is not yo' Mama's average lunch truck. It is obviously the one that the TV show "Hawaii 5-0" modeled its crab shack truck on, right down to the coloring ... We stumbled upon this food truck on our first evening in Oahu. It was amazing!! I have never eaten from a food truck before but Gilligan's did not disappoint! It is in such a great location & the food is excellent. We had it twice on our short trip! Stop by here if you get the chance!

Gilligan's has been around since long before food trucks were fashionable. It's somewhat of a Waikiki institution. If you haven't had the fresh garlic covered shrimp (prawns) from the yellow truck parked near the Hilton Hawaiian Village lagoon, then you are truly missing out!

I was sick for days after eating their famous GARLIC SHRIMP.

At first I thought I heard incorrectly...Turkey Tails? Could that taste good? I was willing to give it a go. I ordered, lau lau, white rice, char siu pork, chili pepper waterand BBQ turkey tails.
Wow!!! Is all I can say. Authentic hawaiian food is being churned out of Youngs daily. The menu is extensive and the portions are HUGE....


More  



Young's was on our list of must try local spots. We really enjoy Hawaiian food and we were not disappointed. Young's seems more like a deli/fish market but there is seating inside.
The highlights of this stop: poke, tripe stew and turkey butts.
Poke - You can't go wrong with getting poke from a fish market. The poke was fresh...


More  



Typical Hawaiian and "local" Hawaii fusion foods..... love everything !!! To at like the folks who live in Hawaii.....

Young's has been around for a while and I've been going here since they were in the Kapalama Shopping Center. Large portions and good food. But like all good Hawaiian food, it's not cheap for a plate lunch.

Get this plate if you like laulau. The pork is the best tasting. It comes with rice or poi or both. Lomi salmon or salad. It definitely hits the spot and you can still have dessert. The haupia is delicious. I would recommend this place. Eat in or take out.

Went searching for the best Lau Lau in Honolulu and concluded that if you want significant Butter Fish you need to order one Butter Fish and one regular Lau Lau to eat together.

Obviously, they sell fish, but they also sell non-aquatic Hawaiian food. The prices are moderate, the products are very fresh. Friendly service. Also sells lunch plates.

review_list:
I'm always on the search for the perfect Ahi poki bowl and I found it here. It's in a little health food store called Ruffage. I walked by it. Total hole in the wall. So fresh. Great looking salads and sandwiches!

the important thing is that they moved to kuhio ave. opposite site of vive waikiki hotel,next to ruffage(??) natural food. i took over 30 min to roam the koa ave. T.T. it was healthy seafood meal. I loved it a lot.

This small counter restaurant in a health store has delicious ahi bowls. The service is pretty quick and there are only a few tables so make sure to go at an off time to grab a seat. Decent prices for this fresh Hawaiian fare!

Poke bowls were good. Better to get without rice. They don't give as much fish when you order with rice. Also they sell chicken bowls, healthy smoothies & organic items.

The restaraunt is a bit small but the food is very good and it is close to the hotel I stayed at. The place was a bit small but overall the food was good and it was cooked very fast

Walking distance from most of the hotels on the main strip, this place is a hidden gem. Affordable food with a local divey whole foods vibe. I am a little disappointed I didn’t discover this place earlier and got suckered into eating overpriced crap at the other restaurants in the area.

For sure a gem! Not far away from the Waikiki Beach but still hidden away in a small alley is Ahi bowl & pot. We ordered the Ahi poke and avocado salad, spicy tuna and an ebi bowl!
All was delicious and it had a great local feel to the place! Only down side is very limited seating.

Killer poke and amazingly delicious chicken curry. Perfect portions, served with rice and miso soup (best miso i've ever had).

I had the Ahi Poke Salad, hubby had Spicy Tuna Salad. Both amazing, so fresh, and well represented on their photo menu. The spot is a simple lunch counter, but the fresh seafood more than compensates for the lack of atmosphere.

Nothing special, but very good. Ahi poke avacado bowl was just that... With brown or white rice. They throw in a styrofoam cup of miso soup. Very casual, quick and good.
There's a health food restaurant attached... Order at the same counter.

title: Iyasume Seaside, Honolulu

review_list:
After climbing Koko Crater Trail we needed refreshment and Kokonuts was perfect! The servings are huge--even the small--but it's just what you need on a hot day. There was something like 20 flavours to choose from AND they put enough flavouring on it--not the wishy-washy dribbling that most snow cones have. Definitely going back again!

I prefer another Shave Ice place about a mile away but this one is good too. I also prefer the traditional trucks/shacks on the beach... it's good but I think it looses something to have shave ice in front of a solid structure and not on the beach.

Not many shave ice places...this one great, many choices of flavors, service was quick!
Crepes too...nice little treat near Honolulu harbor...stop by on the way or after Spitting Rock of Portluck!

Just grabbed a quick Shave Ice after climbing the Koko Head trail. I was able to get ice cream and condensed milk, which I like, so that was good. Price was reasonable. However, they only take cash, so plan accordingly.

A refreshing and delicious side trip after Hanauma Bay! I had my shave ice with ice cap and 3 tropical flavors! YUM!! After, I saw many customers with other treats like the huge ice cream fruit Crepes. I will definitely have to try the Acai Bowl next time!!!

This is the place President Obama took his family for fantastic shave ice. I brought relatives from the East Coast and they seriously enjoyed the island treat. It's a great light alternative to a heavy dessert if you have eaten at one of the other restaurants nearby. Totally up for a repeat.

I work at the marina and stop into Kokonuts once a month for a special treat. The shave ice is good and you can get it with all sorts of extras.

Flaky and soft just like snow. No icy clumps. Place was busy and the one person working there moved quickly and efficiently.

I got a large shaved ice with ice cream in middle. It was DELICIOUS! This is the perfect snack to grab after snorkeling in Hanauma Bay.

I love the shave ice at Kokonuts. There are so many flavors to choose from, and the shave ice is made just right. Be sure to make this a stop before or after going to Hanauma Bay. You won't regret it.

I love this place for family dinners. They have great Japanese style sides with miso soup and choice of main dishes. Their rich is unique and very yummy. Great friendly staff make this place a win win.

Rib sticking food. Wife had the 2 choice set with fish. I had the katsu-tama. Everything is hot and delicious. Served promptly to your table by a very energetic and attentive staff. No pressure to eat and vacate the table that is so common at many restaurants. Great food, great prices, and very friendly staff.

First of all, the restaurant name is mispelled. It's "HINONE" Mizunone. There is a good variety of "just like home cooked" Japanese meals. The teishoku sets are good (katsu, fish, tempura). We like even just their side orders of tempura, saba, or nikujyaga. The atmosphere is casual but the food is what counts and it is tasty!

You could order ala carte, but why would you? The complete meal sets are worth the extra. Makes you feel like you're back in Japan. The tempura was excellent and the service was even better. The rice was superior to virtually all other Japanese restaurants. Will definitely become a regular haunt.

Very reasonably priced lunch menu. Had udon so hard to ruin. Nothing really good or bad to say. Ambiance was a bit disappointing. Will give it another try and order something different.

Went again for lunch with my ladies and we enjoyed the food and of course the company. The Parking is very limited and you would have to park on the street. It is kind of pricey and they don't have daily specials. But the food is great.

Very comfortable family restaurant. Take family there often. Reasonably priced good food. Japanese style egg omelet is delicious.

My wife and I on a short trip to Honolulu from Maui stopped here after a long day in the city. They have reasonably priced beer, great music, great service, and good conversation with all the friendly patrons at the bar. If you are looking for a dive bar, this is your place!

This bar is tiny and full of locals. It's refreshing to come into after a day shopping or beaching or anything. Dana and Buddy, the two barmen we met were great! Do yourself a favor!

This lovely little hole in the wall, is a great place to get your drink on. Ever so slightly seedy, but always a great time. Never judge a book by it's cover!

This is a great bar if you want to feel like you live here. Very reasonable drink prices, ans drink specials daily. Where can you get a maitai in Hawaii for $3.25 in the day and $4.25 at night?? Very friendly service. The bar is also really clean. Taco Tuesday is a must. $1 chicken tacos. The salsa is homemade!

This place is a dive bar. No other way to describe it. Locals hangout. Great chicken tacos for $1.00 on Tuesdays. We were there two Tuesdays just for those.

This is off the tourist path. A dive bar in the best possible sense. Drinks are strong and cheap. We were welcomed like old friends. Exceptional service from Summer and Kitty. We were lucky and were there for a filming of Hawaii 5-0. Quite the experience. Went back several times.

Sommer was the best, atmosphere was welcoming and just down right fun! Great to get off the tourist path and spend time here.

On Tuesdays for a buck. Expect a hole in the wall and you'll be happy. Patrons are from all over and were friendly. Buddy the bar tender was cool.

Taco Tuesday had $1 tacos, an absolute steal for anyone walking the shore of Wakiki Beach! Server was friendly, and food was fairly fast.

It has been sold and there is no more karaoke here. The pol and darts priority now. The new tables and stools look good. the place looks much bigger. bar is still dark.

review_list:
Great food, fun environment, great live music. Beautiful view of the beach, was perfect to have drinks with friends and watch the sunset.

Was told about this place by a couple from Australia and decided to check it out. It was awesome! Loved the whole vibe of this place. I captured a beautiful sunset sitting on the patio. Service was great and so was the music.

Enjoyed strolling through Tiki Town almost every evening we were there. It's filled with some wonderful boutiques and restaurants that offer something for everyone. You will find so many unique items and items native to the Islands. We were there August of 2013, fantastic place, would love to return.

There wasn't overly a big variety of items on the menu. Although this venue was always busy when we went past. Out of all menu items, there was only 1 dish we both liked. Great vibe and entertainment though.

Iv'e been coming here for years with friends.It's the perfect spot for a midday pick-me-up on a beach day. It's a really funky outdoor tiki bar that cuts straight to the chase. By that, I mean they pour a strong Mai Tai : )

We went to Tiki town a couple times. Short walk from hotel and the staff and food were great. pricing is reasonable and the portions were more than enough. Happy Hour was always crowded, but fun. Dislikes, tables were kind of wobbly and sticky.

I enjoyed a pork lau lau dinner (pork steamed in poi, served with rice and relishes) for less than $20.00. Simple, tasty street food simply prepared. Very satisfying. They also serve garlic shrimp, loco moco, burgers, a few other local favorites. The adjacent bar has the same menu. My kind of place! Check it out.

Part of the old International marketplace I hope this quaint little place survives somewhere. Open air, musical entertainment with large Tiki statue atmosphere. great fun when just strolling Waikiki following the strains of Hawaiian ukulele music.

A simple little place with cold beer and fantastic entertainment. We were just strolling through the markets, heard the music and dropped in, it turned out to be the best little stroll!

The music offered, especially Sunday and Wednesday was quite exceptional. Fun and friendly is probably the best to describe it. We thoroughly enjoyed the relaxed and laid back ambience. So naturally we returned more than once. The service was attentive and the music varied and fun.

This is a chain of restaurants in Honolulu and they serve the best (I mean THE BEST) tantan ramen bowls. The service is quick and the queue easy even if the restaurant is consistently full any given time. We have been to this branch several times but more often visited the one in Kahala Mall.

Noodles with spicy tan tan broth are very good. Table seating is limited; so one needs to eat at off hours unless one is comfortable with counter service.
Large selection of side dishes available; would recommend gyoza or chicken karaage.

I loved the TERIYAKI CHICKEN BOWL.
It was extremely filling with a very large bowl of rice and lots of chicken. The egg on top was the icing on the cake. The staff are friendly but most importantly efficient. I ate there several times during my four day stay.

Tasty! Lots of food for a good price. Each entree is big enough to share. Plate lunches at there local finest!

By all standards this is a greta place to get local food. Granted, it looks like the brick and mortar version of a food trailer, but the food is great, fast and tasty! Everybody on the island loves it, so there is usually a line.

The food here is consistently good. You can count on it, and its a good value as well My favorite thing to order is the Barbeque Chicken Plate, since I'm usually dieting, and I order it with all green salad .

If you want what the Kamaaina eat for lunch, visit an L & L. It's fast food Hawaiian style, and better and cheaper than your typical McDonalds meal.

Its a good place to eat, lots of choices and the prices are average.

A good value plate lunch. If you want a lot of food for your money, this is the place. The chicken teri and kalbi have yummy sauce. A can never eat the whole thing.

Smaller fast food chain with lots of local character. Portions are large and the menu tends towards deep frying; Hawaii is not a dieter's paradise. Many locations on Oahu.

This was the first place I stopped to eat when I came to O'ahu. I ordered the garlic shrimp. Maybe because I was starving, who knows, but it was some of the best garlic shrimp I've ever eaten. We had the BBQ chicken and the mixed BBQ plate. Fed two people for $20--and probably could have been stretched into another meal the next day as it was too much food-but we ate it all! They have one on Kuhio Ave and one in the Walmart near Ala Moana as well.

love fav

The food is fast food and is good, Not special, bit not bad either, We needed a quick lunch and this fit the requirement.

The Ala Moana Food Court is huge, noisy, usually very busy, with something for everyone at reasonable (for Honolulu) prices. I like the shrimp summer rolls here. The lemongrass tea was quite sweet.

Family of 12 went to eat here, the portion of the food is a very good serving size, staff was nice. Not to much parking.

Chinese food in Hawaii is, for me, is meant to be comfort food----and Golden Duck is just that. Nothing fancy, but reliable, fast, and delicious Chinese food. You can tell by the woman sitting at the counter turning a huge pile of pork has into wontons and gau gee. No food snobbery here, just honest food at very honest prices.

The shrimp fried rice was amazing. So was the Egg Fu Yung. Will definitely be back. The service was wonderful and the food came out very quickly. Had a wonderful experience.

Golden Duck on King Street is a convenient location for takeout. There's a parking lot oceanside of the freestanding building. The beef broccoli has the classic chop suey house tenderized beef and the green crunchy, mostly unpeeled broccoli.

Traveling with teenage boys, you can't go wrong here. Easy to walk to from Waikiki Beach. Tables located at the front. Eat dinner or lunch and people watch. Also with views to the ocean across the road. Cheap eating for a family with teenagers.

Just an ordinary Burger King with everyday low prices on Waikiki Beach. Tables are outside so you can enjoy the weather.

What can I say It's fast-food , cheap, fast, and easy. Love there croissant-wich breakfast but overall nothing unique.

This is a small Burger King. We had a late breakfast, wasn't busy. They had a special. If you are at the beach, this is a good choice for a meal or a snack.

Burger King in Hawaii? Good for a quick cheap breakfast! A little higher price than the mainland but cheaper than a restaurant.

Had a couple of breakfast burritos and coffee. No indoor seating. Ate at table outside on sidewalk. It was a bit hot, and too many people walking by as well as some soliciting for "hungry children," "homeless" and "abused women." All worthy causes, but I just wanted to eat a burrito in peace.

It was ok....a burger is a burger. Customer service on the other hand was lacking. I had a hard time convincing the order taker to substitute fries with another items. Meanwhile next to me another customer was demanding their money back because of poor attitude from the other order taker.

Makes little sense to eat fast foods when on vacation in Hawaii, except as in my case, wanting a quick something at the end of the day. I opted for a chicken sandwich that was as tricky to hold on to as a flopping fish. Soggy bun and everything in it wanted out. Ugh.

Superb offer on at Burger King at present,buy whopper meal and get a free whopper you can't get much better than that

In the heart of the strip and reasonably priced with some very good deals for families - good customer service.

review_list:
Love their bbq plates here. My favorite is there combo bbq plate with teri beef, and chicken, two scoops rice, and mac salad. Good quality, portions for a great price. Nice friendly family place.

Love the mochico chicken and BBQ chicken and Katsu chicken. You get a large portion of food and feel satisfied when done eating.
title: Manoa Bar-B-Que, Honolulu

review_list:
In a strip mall across the Honolulu Convention Center. This place gets very busy whenever conventions are held. Great friendly efficient staff.

Their pastrami sandwich is delicious. They stack the meat on, just the way it should be. Quick service, reasonable prices with specials available on a regular basis. Good franchise option at this shopping center, in between Hawaii Kai and Kahala.

Great choices (as well as many vegetarian choices) await lunch patrons at what must be the only Armenian-Greek restaurant in town (although most people think of it as 'Greek' due to its popularity and familiarity). For lunch my wife and I shared the Vegetarian Combo (5 items) and a gyro. Both were excellent and prices were very good considering the downtown Honolulu location. Would like to go back, but a little far from Northern Virginia.

Come here for the delicious chicken kabobs (off the stick when you get them), great hummus, and (small but good) salad (good by Hawaii standards, which is just lettuce that isn't brown). review_list:
I love going to this place but my favorite day is Thursday. They make an amazing greek platter and have several options of sizes. I always get the $9.00 Greek Platter with Broccoli Salad, Lentil Salad, Tabbouleh Salad and homemade hummus with lots of pita bread. You can order extra side salads if you are craving more food. $9.00 later,...
